author: John Cross
title: Arsenal in transfer limbo as uncertainty over Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez futures delays other deals
text:
Sport Arsenal in transfer limbo as uncertainty over Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez futures delays other deals Star duo both want £200,000 a week — which would impact any new contracts for likes of Wilshere and Oxlade-Chamberlain as well as summer signings Share Arsenal are waiting on their key pair — and even Wenger's status for next season is unclear (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Arsene Wenger has had to put Arsenal 's transfer plans on hold until their contract stand-offs with Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil are resolved. 
Gunners' boss Wenger remains confident that Ozil will eventually sign a new deal, but there are doubts over fellow star Sanchez — whose fury after Tuesday's dramatic draw at Bournemouth, and two dropped points, spoke volumes. 
The protracted negotiations with the pair are having a knock-on effect for other players. 
Ozil and Sanchez both want pay-rises to more than £200,000 a week, which would impact on Arsenal’s finances as they look to negotiate new contracts with the likes of Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Jack Wilshere and plan their summer signings. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger faces the press after Bournemouth draw Share this video Watch Next 
It means the North Londoners are in limbo until they know whether Sanchez and Ozil will stay, and talks with them are unlikely to be resolved in the near future. 
Sanchez has already been linked with a £400,000 a week move to China and knows he can earn more than he's currently on without leaving in Europe — Manchester City and Chelsea are both bigger payers than Arsenal, while Italian champions Juventus are also keen. 
The Chile star has also made it clear his future is not just about money as he wants success. 
That explained his end-of-match meltdown after Arsenal dropped two points at Bournemouth, leaving them well off the title pace. Chelsea could give Sanchez more money without having to move to China (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Wenger has also made it clear that a lot of Ozil’s talks have been about wanting trophies as well as money and the uncertainty is being felt throughout the club. 
Despite completing the most difficult stage of paying for the Emirates Stadium, the club is still run on a tight budget and it is unlikely they would stretch to £250,000 a week for their two biggest stars. 
Arsenal face worries over a raft of first-team players who have 18 months left on their current deals, including Oxlade-Chamberlain, Wilshere and England full-back Kieran Gibbs. 
That is part of why they are being kept waiting on deals, as the club want to keep the books in order. Oxlade-Chamberlain and Wilshere may have to wait until the Gunners' big two decide (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) 
They are set to trigger extensions for Santi Cazorla and Per Mertesacker, but know the squad is looking closely at the talks with star men Ozil and Sanchez. 
Wenger and the hierarchy know that if they break the bank for that pair, then other big names could also come back asking for pay-rises. 
They recently managed to secure full-back Hector Bellerin – a target for Man City and former club Barcelona – on a six-year contract worth around £100,000 a week. 
Arsenal have been eyeing Borussia Dortmund’s Marco Reus as a potential replacement if they have to sell either Ozil or Sanchez in the summer, but they cannot press ahead with that until they know the outcome of the talks. Possible replacement Reus may not be needed if Ozil and Sanchez DO stay (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
Wenger himself is also out of contract this summer. 
There is a two-year deal worth £8million a year on the table waiting to be signed. 
But the Frenchman knows if Arsenal lose a big star and finish outside the top four the fans could react badly, and that adds to the doubts over whether he will put pen to paper. poll loading Will Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil sign new deals? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
